intro: Batrachium paucistamineum subsp. trichophyllum, commonly known as the hairy batrachium, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded, moist environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing white or pale yellow petals. The subspecies is distinguished by its dense pubescence, which gives it its common name.
